_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: CurseForge Generic (Java)
author: contact@chromozone.dev
description: A generic egg for a CurseForge modpack.
startup: java $([[ -f user_jvm_args.txt ]] && printf %s "@user_jvm_args.txt") -Xms128M -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=95.0 -Dterminal.jline=false -Dterminal.ansi=true $([[ ! -f unix_args.txt ]] && printf %s "-jar `cat .serverjar`" || printf %s "@unix_args.txt") nogui

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# shellcheck disable=SC2155
#
# CurseForge Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server

: "${SERVER_DIR:=/mnt/server}"
: "${PROJECT_ID:=}"
: "${VERSION_ID:=}"
: "${API_KEY:=}"

# Garantir que estamos na pasta correta e ela existe
if [[ ! -d $SERVER_DIR ]]; then
    mkdir -p "$SERVER_DIR"
fi

if ! cd "$SERVER_DIR"; then
    echo -e "Failed to change directory to ${SERVER_DIR}"
    exit 1
fi

function install_required {
    echo -e "Installing required packages..."
    # Verifica se usa apt (Debian/Ubuntu) ou apk (Alpine)
    if [ -n "$(command -v apt-get)" ]; then
        echo -e "\tRunning apt update"
        apt-get update -y > /dev/null 2>&1
        echo -e "\tRunning apt install"
        apt-get install -y wget jq unzip > /dev/null 2>&1
    elif [ -n "$(command -v apk)" ]; then
        echo -e "\tRunning apk update"
        apk update > /dev/null 2>&1
        echo -e "\tRunning apk add"
        apk add --no-cache wget jq unzip > /dev/null 2>&1
    else
        echo "Package manager not found. Continuing anyway..."
    fi
}

CURSEFORGE_API_URL="https://api.curseforge.com/v1/mods/"
CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS=("--header=Accept: application/json" "--header=x-api-key: ${API_KEY}")

function get_download {
    echo -e "Retrieving CurseForge project information..."
    local PROJECT_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}" -O -)
    local PROJECT_TITLE=$(echo "$PROJECT_DATA" | jq -r '.data.name // empty')

    if [[ -z "${PROJECT_DATA}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: Failed to retrieve project data for project id '${PROJECT_ID}'"
        exit 1
    fi

    local IS_SERVER_PACK=false

    if [[ -z "${VERSION_ID}" || "${VERSION_ID}" == "latest" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tNo file ID specified, using latest file"
        VERSION_ID=$(echo "$PROJECT_DATA" | jq -r '.data.mainFileId // empty')

        local VERSION_SERVER_PACK="$(echo -e "${PROJECT_DATA}" | jq -r --arg VERSION_ID "$VERSION_ID" '.data.latestFiles[] | select(.id|tostring==$VERSION_ID) | .isServerPack')"
        local VERSION_SERVER_ID="$(echo -e "${PROJECT_DATA}" | jq -r --arg VERSION_ID "$VERSION_ID" '.data.latestFiles[] | select(.id|tostring==$VERSION_ID) | .serverPackFileId')"

        if [[ "${VERSION_SERVER_PACK}" == "false" && -n "${VERSION_SERVER_ID}" && "${VERSION_SERVER_ID}" != "null" ]]; then
            echo -e "\tFound server pack file id '${VERSION_SERVER_ID}'"
            VERSION_ID=$VERSION_SERVER_ID
            IS_SERVER_PACK=true
        elif [[ "${VERSION_SERVER_PACK}" == "true" ]]; then
            IS_SERVER_PACK=true
        fi
    else
        echo -e "\tChecking if provided file id '${VERSION_ID}' exists"

        local FILE_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}/files/${VERSION_ID}" -O -)

        if [[ -z "${FILE_DATA}" ]]; then
            echo -e "\tERROR: File id '${VERSION_ID}' not found for project '${PROJECT_TITLE}'"
            exit 1
        fi

        IS_SERVER_PACK=$(echo -e "${FILE_DATA}" | jq -r '.data.isServerPack // "false"')

        if [[ "${IS_SERVER_PACK}" == "false" ]]; then
            local VERSION_SERVER_PACK="$(echo -e "${FILE_DATA}" | jq -r '.data.serverPackFileId // empty')"
            if [[ -n "${VERSION_SERVER_PACK}" && "${VERSION_SERVER_PACK}" != "null" ]]; then
                echo -e "\tFound server pack file id '${VERSION_SERVER_PACK}'"
                VERSION_ID=$VERSION_SERVER_PACK
                IS_SERVER_PACK=true
            fi
        else
            IS_SERVER_PACK=true
        fi
    fi

    if [[ -z "${VERSION_ID}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: No file id found for project '${PROJECT_TITLE}'"
        exit 1
    fi

    if [[ "${IS_SERVER_PACK}" == "false" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tWARNING: File id '${VERSION_ID}' is not a server pack, attempting to use client files"
    fi

    echo -e "\tRetrieving version information for '${VERSION_ID}'"
    local JSON_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}/files/${VERSION_ID}/download-url" -O -)

    if [[ -z "${JSON_DATA}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: Failed to retrieve file data for file id '${VERSION_ID}'"
        exit 1
    fi

    echo -e "\tParsing CurseForge pack download url"
    local DOWNLOAD_URL=$(echo -e "$JSON_DATA" | jq -r '.data // empty')
    
    if [[ -z "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" || "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" == "null" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: No download url found for file ${VERSION_ID}"
        exit 1
    fi

    echo -e "\tDownloading ${DOWNLOAD_URL}"
    if ! wget -q "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" -O server.zip; then
        echo -e "Download failed!"
        exit 1
    fi
}

function get_loader {
    echo -e "Retrieving loader information..."

    # Re-validar dados básicos
    local PROJECT_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}" -O -)
    local PROJECT_TITLE=$(echo "$PROJECT_DATA" | jq -r '.data.name // empty')
    
    local FILE_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}/files/${VERSION_ID}" -O -)

    local IS_SERVER_PACK=$(echo -e "${FILE_DATA}" | jq -r '.data.isServerPack // "false"')
    local CLIENT_VERSION_ID;

    if [[ "${IS_SERVER_PACK}" == "true" ]]; then
        CLIENT_VERSION_ID="$(echo -e "${FILE_DATA}" | jq -r '.data.parentProjectFileId // empty')"
    else
        CLIENT_VERSION_ID=$VERSION_ID
    fi

    # Se falhar em achar o ID pai, usa o atual
    if [[ -z "${CLIENT_VERSION_ID}" || "${CLIENT_VERSION_ID}" == "null" ]]; then
        CLIENT_VERSION_ID=$VERSION_ID
    fi

    echo -e "\tRetrieving file information for '${CLIENT_VERSION_ID}'"
    local JSON_DATA=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${PROJECT_ID}/files/${CLIENT_VERSION_ID}/download-url" -O -)
    local DOWNLOAD_URL=$(echo -e "$JSON_DATA" | jq -r '.data // empty')

    if [[ -z "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: No download url found for client file id ${CLIENT_VERSION_ID}"
        exit 1
    fi

    echo -e "\tDownloading Client Zip for Manifest info..."
    wget -q "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" -O client.zip

    echo -e "\tUnpacking client manifest"
    if ! unzip -jo client.zip manifest.json -d "${SERVER_DIR}"; then
         echo "ERROR: Failed to extract manifest.json from client.zip"
         exit 1
    fi
    
    mv "${SERVER_DIR}/manifest.json" "${SERVER_DIR}/client.manifest.json"
    rm -rf client.zip

    echo -e "\tParsing client manifest"
    local MANIFEST="${SERVER_DIR}/client.manifest.json"

    # CORRECAO: Verifica NeoForge AGORA que o arquivo existe
    if grep -q "neoforge" "${MANIFEST}"; then
        echo -e "\tDetected NeoForge in manifest string."
        LOADER_NAME="neoforge"
    fi

    LOADER_ID=$(jq -r '.minecraft.modLoaders[]? | select(.primary == true) | .id' "${MANIFEST}")
    
    # Se ja nao for neoforge, tenta descobrir pelo ID
    if [[ -z "$LOADER_NAME" ]]; then
        LOADER_NAME=$(echo "${LOADER_ID}" | cut -d'-' -f1)
    fi
    
    LOADER_VERSION=$(echo "${LOADER_ID}" | cut -d'-' -f2)

    if [[ -z "${LOADER_NAME}" || -z "${LOADER_VERSION}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: No loader found in client manifest!"
        exit 1
    fi

    MINECRAFT_VERSION=$(jq -r '.minecraft.version // empty' "${MANIFEST}")

    if [[ -z "${MINECRAFT_VERSION}" ]]; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: No minecraft version found in client manifest!"
        exit 1
    fi

    echo -e "\tFound loader ${LOADER_NAME} ${LOADER_VERSION} for Minecraft ${MINECRAFT_VERSION}"
}

function unzip-strip() (
    set -u
    local archive=$1
    local destdir=${2:-}
    shift; shift || :
    echo -e "\tUnpacking ${archive} to ${destdir}"

    local tmpdir=/mnt/server/tmp
    mkdir -p "${tmpdir}"
    trap 'rm -rf -- "$tmpdir"' EXIT

    if ! unzip -q "$archive" -d "$tmpdir"; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: unzip failed"
        return 1
    fi

    shopt -s dotglob
    local files=("$tmpdir"/*)
    local name

    # Logica para remover pasta raiz se existir
    if (( ${#files[@]} == 1 )) && [[ -d "${files[0]}" ]]; then
        files=("$tmpdir"/*/*)
    else
        files=("$tmpdir"/*)
    fi

    if [[ -z "$destdir" ]]; then
        destdir=./
    fi

    cp -ar "$@" -t "$destdir" -- "${files[@]}"
    rm -rf "$tmpdir"
)

function unpack_zip {
    echo -e "Unpacking server files..."
    unzip-strip server.zip "${SERVER_DIR}"
    rm -rf server.zip
}

function json_download_mods {
    echo "Downloading mods..."
    local MANIFEST="${SERVER_DIR}/manifest.json"
    
    # Checa se manifest existe antes de ler
    if [[ ! -f "$MANIFEST" ]]; then
        echo "Manifest not found at $MANIFEST, skipping mod download."
        return
    fi

    jq -c '.files[]? | select(.required == true) | {project: .projectID, file: .fileID}' "${MANIFEST}" | while read -r mod; do
        local MOD_PROJECT_ID=$(echo "${mod}" | jq -r '.project // empty')
        local MOD_FILE_ID=$(echo "${mod}" | jq -r '.file // empty')

        if [[ -n "${MOD_PROJECT_ID}" && -n "${MOD_FILE_ID}" ]]; then
            local FILE_URL=$(wget -q "${CURSEFORGE_API_HEADERS[@]}" "${CURSEFORGE_API_URL}${MOD_PROJECT_ID}/files/${MOD_FILE_ID}/download-url" -O - | jq -r '.data // empty')
            
            if [[ -n "${FILE_URL}" && "${FILE_URL}" != "null" ]]; then
                echo -e "\tDownloading Mod: ${MOD_PROJECT_ID}..."
                wget -q "${FILE_URL}" -P "${SERVER_DIR}/mods"
            fi
        fi
    done
}

function json_download_overrides {
    echo "Copying overrides..."
    if [[ -d "${SERVER_DIR}/overrides" ]]; then
        cp -r "${SERVER_DIR}/overrides/"* "${SERVER_DIR}"
        rm -rf "${SERVER_DIR}/overrides"
    fi
}

FORGE_INSTALLER_URL="https://maven.minecraftforge.net/net/minecraftforge/forge/"

function json_download_forge {
    echo "Downloading Forge..."
    local MC_VERSION=$MINECRAFT_VERSION
    local FORGE_VERSION=$LOADER_VERSION

    # Ajuste para versoes antigas
    local F_FULL="${MC_VERSION}-${FORGE_VERSION}"
    if [[ "${MC_VERSION}" == "1.7.10" || "${MC_VERSION}" == "1.8.9" ]]; then
        F_FULL="${F_FULL}-${MC_VERSION}"
    fi

    local FORGE_URL="${FORGE_INSTALLER_URL}${F_FULL}/forge-${F_FULL}-installer.jar"
    echo -e "\tDownloading Installer from ${FORGE_URL}"

    if ! wget -q -O forge-installer.jar "${FORGE_URL}"; then
        echo -e "\tERROR: Failed to download Forge Installer."
        exit 1
    fi

    rm -rf libraries/net/minecraftforge/forge/
    
    echo -e "\tInstalling Forge..."
    java -jar forge-installer.jar --installServer > /dev/null 2>&1

    # Logica de renomeacao
    if [[ -f "run.sh" || -f "run.bat" ]]; then 
         echo "Modern Forge detected."
         # Muitas vezes o Pterodactyl espera server.jar ou unix_args, 
         # mas o script de start padrao do egg lida com isso se os args estiverem la.
         if [ -d "libraries/net/minecraftforge/forge" ]; then
            ln -sf libraries/net/minecraftforge/forge/*/unix_args.txt unix_args.txt
         fi
    else
         # Forge antigo
         if [[ -f "forge-${F_FULL}.jar" ]]; then
             mv "forge-${F_FULL}.jar" forge-server-launch.jar
         elif [[ -f "forge-${F_FULL}-universal.jar" ]]; then
             mv "forge-${F_FULL}-universal.jar" forge-server-launch.jar
         fi
         echo "forge-server-launch.jar" > ".serverjar"
    fi
    rm -f forge-installer.jar
}

FABRIC_INSTALLER_URL="https://meta.fabricmc.net/v2/versions/installer"

function json_download_fabric {
    echo "Downloading Fabric..."
    local INSTALLER_JSON=$(wget -q -O - ${FABRIC_INSTALLER_URL})
    local INSTALLER_URL=$(echo "$INSTALLER_JSON" | jq -r '.[0].url // empty')

    wget -q -O fabric-installer.jar "${INSTALLER_URL}"
    java -jar fabric-installer.jar server -mcversion "${MINECRAFT_VERSION}" -loader "${LOADER_VERSION}" -downloadMinecraft
    echo "fabric-server-launch.jar" > ".serverjar"
    rm -f fabric-installer.jar
}

QUILT_INSTALLER_URL="https://meta.quiltmc.org/v3/versions/installer"

function json_download_quilt {
    echo "Downloading Quilt..."
    local INSTALLER_JSON=$(wget -q -O - ${QUILT_INSTALLER_URL})
    local INSTALLER_URL=$(echo "$INSTALLER_JSON" | jq -r '.[0].url // empty')

    wget -q -O quilt-installer.jar "${INSTALLER_URL}"
    java -jar quilt-installer.jar install server "${MINECRAFT_VERSION}" "${LOADER_VERSION}" --download-server --install-dir=./
    echo "quilt-server-launch.jar" > ".serverjar"
    rm quilt-installer.jar
}

NEOFORGE_INSTALLER_URL="https://maven.neoforged.net/releases"

function json_download_neoforge {
    echo "Downloading NeoForge..."
    local NEO_URL="${NEOFORGE_INSTALLER_URL}/net/neoforged/neoforge/${LOADER_VERSION}/neoforge-${LOADER_VERSION}-installer.jar"

    echo -e "\tURL: ${NEO_URL}"
    wget -q -O neoforge-installer.jar "${NEO_URL}"
    
    rm -rf libraries/net/neoforged/neoforge
    
    echo -e "\tInstalling NeoForge..."
    java -jar neoforge-installer.jar --installServer > /dev/null 2>&1
    
    # Setup unix_args
    if [ -d "libraries/net/neoforged/neoforge" ]; then
         ln -sf libraries/net/neoforged/neoforge/$LOADER_VERSION/unix_args.txt unix_args.txt
    fi
    rm -f neoforge-installer.jar
}

# --- EXECUCAO ---

install_required

if [[ -z "${PROJECT_ID}" ]]; then
    echo "ERROR: PROJECT_ID not set!"
    exit 1
fi

if [[ "${PROJECT_ID}" != "zip" ]]; then
    get_download
fi

get_loader
unpack_zip

if [[ -f "${SERVER_DIR}/manifest.json" ]]; then
    echo "Found manifest.json, installing mods..."
    json_download_mods
    json_download_overrides
fi

# Verifica loader baseado na info coletada
if [[ -n "$LOADER_NAME" ]]; then
    if [[ "$LOADER_NAME" == "forge" ]]; then
        json_download_forge
    elif [[ "$LOADER_NAME" == "fabric" ]]; then
        json_download_fabric
    elif [[ "$LOADER_NAME" == "quilt" ]]; then
        json_download_quilt
    elif [[ "$LOADER_NAME" == "neoforge" ]]; then
        json_download_neoforge
    fi
fi

echo "eula=true" > eula.txt
echo -e "\nInstall completed successfully!"

variables.name: Modpack Project ID
variables.description:
The modpack project ID from the CurseForge site on the pack page, or 'zip' if installing from an uploaded server.zip file.

For example, the project Id of https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/modpacks/bofa-mods ID is 375152

variables.name: Modpack File ID
variables.description:
The file ID belonging to a specific version of a modpack. Can either be the main file or the file ID associated with the server pack.

If not provided the script will attempt to retrieve the latest server pack or client pack available.

variables.name: CurseForge API Key
variables.description: A CurseForge API key is required to use this egg. You can learn how to get an API key here: https://support.curseforge.com/en/support/solutions/articles/9000208346-about-the-curseforge-api-and-how-to-apply-for-a-key
